text: Thomas Dähne (born 4 January 1994) is a German professional footballer who plays as a goalkeeper for Holstein Kiel. ==Club career== Thomas Dähne started his career with TSV 1860 Rosenheim, before moving to the youth teams of Red Bull Salzburg. He then went on to the youth teams of FC Red Bull Salzburg. He played his first match for the Red Bull Juniors on 29 April 2010 in the third league match against TSV St. Johann. He became the main goalkeeper for FC Liefering. He made his debut on 26 May 2013 in a win against FK Austria Wien. Dähne moved to RB Leipzig for the 2014/15 season. After just one season, however, he left Leipzig again without having played a single game for the first team. From 2015 to 2017, Dähne played for Finnish first division club HJK Helsinki in the Veikkausliga. From January 2018, he was under contract with Polish first division club Wisła Płock in the Ekstraklasa for two and a half years. In the summer of 2020 he returned to Germany and joined second division club Holstein Kiel. ==International== Dähne represented Germany in all youth teams up to the Under-20's team.http://www.dfb.de/index.php?id=500413&action;=showPlayer&player;=daehne_thomas⟨=E&cHash;=bb000fa54de4d4f70f15705b0073a05f He was goalkeeper during the 2011 FIFA Under-17 World Cup. ==Honours == *Promotion to the Bundesliga: 2024 * Austrian champion 2014 * Austrian Cup winner: 2014 * Champion of the Regionalliga West: 2013 * Finnish champion: 2017 * Finnish Cup Winner: 2017 ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:German association football goalkeepers Category:FC Red Bull Salzburg players Category:Sportspeople from Bavaria Category:FC Liefering players Category:RB Leipzig players
title: Thomas Dähne
